benchmark_details.name: GLASS (Greimas Literary Analysis via Semiotic Square)
benchmark_details.overview: GLASS is a structured analytical framework based on Greimas Semiotic Square designed to enhance Large Language Models' ability to conduct in-depth literary criticism. It includes the first dataset for GSS-based literary criticism and defines quantitative metrics for evaluating literary criticism produced by LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To propose a novel structuralist AI literary criticism framework that allows Large Language Models to conduct professional and in-depth analyses of narrative patterns and meaning structures in literary works.

data.source: The dataset includes detailed analyses of 49 narrative works, with contributions from both LLM-generated analyses and professional literary scholars' critiques.
data.annotation: The dataset combines expert annotations and LLM-generated analyses.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are systematically evaluated based on scoring criteria defined for the GLASS framework.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores reflect better alignment with expert literary criticism and more profound insights into narrative structures.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance metrics of the GLASS framework compared with human experts across multiple works.
methodology.validation: Framework results compared against established human literary criticism.
